thread.title: Trump slams Democrats on Twitter for 'FAKE' Russia allegations
thread.title_full: Trump slams Democrats on Twitter for 'FAKE' Russia allegations

author: ADAM EDELMAN
title: Trump slams Democrats on Twitter for 'FAKE' Russia allegations
text:
President Trump slams Democrats on Twitter for pushing Russia allegations: 'This story is FAKE NEWS' Trump slams Democrats on Twitter for 'FAKE' Russia allegations "The real story that Congress, the FBI and all others should be looking into is the leaking of Classified information. Must find leaker now!" Trump posted. (JIM_BOURG/REUTERS) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Monday, March 20, 2017, 9:32 AM 
Just hours before FBI Director James Comey was scheduled to deliver testimony regarding Russian efforts to meddle in last year's election, President Trump took to Twitter to accuse Democrats of fabricating the allegations. 
"The Democrats made up and pushed the Russian story as an excuse for running a terrible campaign. Big advantage in Electoral College & lost!" Trump tweeted just after 6:30 a.m. 
"James Clapper and others stated that there is no evidence Potus colluded with Russia. This story is FAKE NEWS and everyone knows it!" he added. 
Comey to reveal whether FBI is probing Trump for Russia ties 
An hour later, Trump went off-topic, tweeting about CNN. FBI Director James Comey (pictured), as well as National Security Agency Director Mike Rogers, are scheduled to testify and their comments could be politically toxic for the Trump White House. (Stephan Savoia/AP) 
"Just heard Fake News CNN is doing polls again despite the fact that their election polls were a WAY OFF disaster. Much higher ratings at Fox," he wrote. 
The tweets came just hours before the first public hearing of the House Intelligence Committee's investigation into Russian interference in the election was slated to kick off. The tweets came just hours before the first public hearing of the House Intelligence Committee's investigation into Russian interference in the election was slated to kick off. (SPUTNIK/REUTERS) 
Comey, as well as National Security Agency Director Mike Rogers, are scheduled to testify and their comments could be politically toxic for the Trump White House. 
President Trump's approval rating sinks lower than Obama's 
Among the topics the duo are expected to discuss are whether there were connections between the Kremlin the Trump campaign and whether anyone inside Trump's inner circle knew of Russian hacking efforts that were designed to disrupt the election. 
They could also definitely shoot down Trump's baseless claim that former President Barack Obama illegally wiretapped Trump Tower. Join the Conversation:
